lines.text: Mom, Listen, I haven't been together with Topanga for twenty-two years, but we *have* been together for sixteen. 'Kay, that's a lot longer than most couples have been together. I mean, when we were born, you told me that we used to take walks in our strollers together in the park. When we were two, we were best friends, I mean, I, I knew everything about this girl. I knew her favorite color. I knew her favorite food. Then we became six, you know, and Eric made fun of me because it wasn't cool to have a best friend that was a girl or even know a girl, so for the next seven years I threw dirt at her. I like to call those "the lost years". Then when I was thirteen, Mom, she put me up against my locker and she kissed me. I mean, she gave me my first kiss. She taught me how to dance. She was always talking about these crazy things and I never understood a word she said. All I understood was that she was the girl I sat up every night thinking about, and when I'm with her I feel happy to be alive. Like I can do anything. Even talk to you like this. So that's, that's what I feel is love, Mom... When I'm better because she's here... and now she won't be. So we're finished.
So I said to myself, 'Kyle,'...
Kyle?
That's what I call myself.

[Cory and Shawn are discussing Cory and Topanga's recent breakup]
Cory, Topanga went out with another guy last night. I'm really sorry, man.
So we're the only two people in the world who still have hope for Topanga and me, and you're throwing in the towel?

[nods]
Sorry, Cory.
All right.
[turns away]
You okay?
Yeah, sure. It's a strange feeling, though.
What, knowing that it's finally over between you and Topanga?

[turns back to face Shawn]
No, being the only one who knows it's not.
Mr. F... F... F... Feeny
I love the Feeny call

I wasn't sure this day would ever come, but you were. I wasn't sure love could survive everything we put it through, but you were. You were always strong and always sure. And now I know I want you to stand beside me for the rest of my life. That's what I'm sure of.
I have to talk to her now, OK.
[to Shawn]
Go ahead.

Ever since I was young I never understood anything about the world, and I never understood anything that happened in my life. The only thing that ever made sense to me was you, and how I felt about you. That's all I've ever known and that's enough, that's enough for me, for the rest of my life. Topanga, we gonna get married?
Yea, we are.
Good, cause, umm I have these rings... I love you, Topanga.
I love you too, Cory.
It's hard to imagine you as a boy. Did your parents call you Mr. Feeny?
[Jack and Eric are dressed up as girls to avoid bullies]
Hmm, double d's, just like your grades.
Mommy, if my dolly's cold, can I put her in the toaster oven?
No, honey. That would be a mistake.
Mommy?
Yes?
I made a mistake.

[runs over to toaster oven and pulls out doll]
Cory, didn't you smell that?
Yeah, I just thought we were having plastic for dinner.
I have a question that I'm going to need a yes or no answer to. How many people get into Yale each year?
No.

You are going to learn something from life every day. And make mistakes. And you'll make good friends and Mr. Feeny will probably teach you every grade you're ever in. And maybe someday you'll fall in love with a woman as wonderful as Topanga. How would you like that?
Yeah.
And be lucky enough to make a good friend as Shawn. How'd you like that?
Good.

And when you're not a little boy anymore, when the world has taught you how to be a man... Then you'll still make mistakes. But your family, and all those good friends you've made along the way, will help you. And even though you'll think the world has gone out of it's way to teach you all the tough lessons, you'll realize that it's the same world that's given you your family and those friends, you you'll come to believe that no matter what happens, somehow the world will protect you, too. "Boy Meets World." Now I get it.
[John Turner is in a coma]

John, how could you be in here? How could you screw up on your bike? I have never seen you screw up on anything. I'm the screw-up, remember? C'mon you remember... Don't do this to me, John. I don't do alone real good... I know you're in there but it's like you're not really here. You're not talking but I know you're here. So I'm just gonna talk, you can listen.
[pause]

John, even when I was at the Centre, it was all the things you taught me that made me wonder if it was the right place for me or not. But you didn't teach me enough. You, and Cory, and my parents, and the Matthews and the handful of people who really care about me, so don't blow me off, John.
[Looks up]

Don't blow me off, God. I never asked you for anything before and I never wanted to come to you like this, but don't take Turner away from me; he's not done yelling at me yet. God, you're not talking but I know you're here, so I'm gonna talk, and you can listen.
[pause]
God, I don't wanna be empty inside any more.
I don't sweat, I glisten.

[hands her a towel]
Well, you're glistening like a pig.
Hey, son! How was your day?
Fine.
What'd you do in school?
Nothing
Hey, *hold on*! Wait there!
You know, everyday I ask you, "What did you do?" and everyday you tell me "Nothing." Well, I'm tired of nothing. I mean we both know something happened in school today and I want to know what it is!
I decided to be a girl.
Well, you taught me a very valuable lesson there, son.
You know the book, "Black Like Me"?
Sure, is that what you guys are reading in school?
Don't ask questions, honey!
[Cory and his mother are compromising]
Thirty minutes.
Half an hour.
Deal.
It was raining... you had an umbrella... I grabbed it, stuffed it down your throat, and then I opened it. Shawn, I Mary Poppinsed ya.
It was one of those nights. You know the kind. Like day, but darker.
Yeah, Shawn, you were wrong about Feeny and you're wrong about this.
You were wrong to break up with Cory.
What does that have to do with anything?
Did any of this happen while you two were still together?
No.
You've killed us. You've killed us all.
Hey, hey. Now there's only two people horribly dead here, that's an acceptable loss.

[reading her yearbook quote to Cory]
You do your thing and I do my thing. You are you and I am I. And, if, in the end, we end up together, it's beautiful.
She kissed me!
And you moved away? What did you do to stop it?

You're right. I said, "Kiss me, baby-sweetie, kill the relationship with the person I care about more than anyone in the world, and make me miserable for the rest of my horrible life." That's what I said.

See, duckies are good, cuz not only do they give you that non-threatening sense of security, but you can feed 'em crackers and you can ride 'em. See, duckies are the horsies of the ocean. No, I mean they are.
Okay, someone explain to me about duckies before I hit him with a spoon.
It's wallpaper.
It's adorable.
It's for you room.
DUCKIES RULE.
Apparently, Cory would rather listen to the game then try and understand the emotional content of Romeo & Juliet.
Mom, I'm a kid. I don't understand the emotional content of Full House.
I do.
That's just what I want - to be Topanga's boyfriend. And then we can name our children Chewbacca and Plankton.
My grades aren't good enough to get me into college?
Your grades, my friend, aren't good enough to get you a Slurpee.
When did this school get a library?
Everyday is a new adventure isn't it?
Boy you are disgrace to this community, this country, and humanity in general!
Oh, wow!
She got sick and said that chicken soup would help her feel better. I told her it probably would. Then I went bowling.
Men are idiots.
What?
Wait! There's more! Men are big idiots.
Hmm... yeah.
Cory, the worst thing that ever happened when we were kids was that your Pop-Tart fell on the ground.
Yeah, and *you* convinced me to eat it. You said, "God made dirt, dirt won't hurt."
[Cory rips the blanket off Topanga and Shawn]
Underpants.
I always sleep like this.
Underpants.
Oh, here we go.
Hunter, Matthews, stand up!
I didn't do it.
Uh huh. Anyway, Hunter, who's your best friend?
Um... you are, sir!
Good answer. Matthews, who's your best friend?
Shawn is.
And what would you do to someone who messes with your best friend?
I'd kill him.
And on that note, I'd like to introduce you to your new teacher and my friend Mr. Williams. So if any of you mess with him, I'll kill you.

[about Topanga]
She goes away for the summer and comes back a woman.
Yeah. Kinda like Coach Franklin.
Would you be my girlfriend?
[Topanga kisses Cory]
Yes or no?
Someday, Topanga's going to be a mother, and I'm going to be the father. Or, the uncle. Or, the way I'm going, the guy down the street with the binoculars.
If I was only going to be alive for one more minute, I'd spend it looking in your eyes.
And if you were only going to be alive for one more minute, I'd tell you to stop lookin'... and start kissin'.
you can't touch it, you can't see it, but you can feel its wrath.
And its goodness. You can feel love's goodness.
I wouldn't know
[Mr. Turner and Mr. Williams break up a fight between Cory and Shawn]
Hunter? Matthews?
Did you guys know you were fighting each other?
[Tommy wants Eric to adopt him]
Do you know what Scooby did when Shaggy fell in the well?
This isn't a cartoon, Tommy.
He SAVED him. He saved him because he LOVED him.
Tommy, you know I love you.
Then why won't you save me?
I, for example, have a young neighbor who sings along to his little sister's Barney records.
You hear that?

[gasp]
Topanga!
[trying to straighten Cory's hair]
Is this stuff supposed to be burning?
Why, is it burning?
No, I was just trying to make conversation, because we don't get enough chances to talk any more.
Mr. Feeny, under my desk is a key. It opens locker 703 in a Florida station. In there is all my homework from the past 5 years. I'm actually a wonderful student. I listen and I know everything.
What's the capital of Montana?
[pause]
You're not going to Florida, are you?
[Cory tells Shawn and Topanga to go out on a date and they ask him why]
Because, if you don't, it's gonna haunt us for the rest of our lives.
Why does everything have to haunt us for the rest of our lives?
Underpants.
I, Cory Matthews, am a PO-TAY-TO.
[discussing how nice looking Mr. Turner's bike is]
You could eat it.
You mean "eat off it".
I said what I said.
Life's tough, get a helmet.
[Cory is hitch-hiking and an Amish man approaches in a carriage]
Hello, young man. Are you in need of a ride? I'm going to that farmhouse there.
[he points]
That farmhouse there?
[points]
That farmhouse there.
[pointing]
Well, I'm going to Philadelphia.
Well, I can take you as far as that farmhouse there.
[points]
Yes, but, you see, I'm going to Philadelphia, so that really does me no good.
That may be, but, my will is just and my heart is pure.
[drives off]
...Which also does me no good.
He says one thing, and does another. He's a hypochondriac.
[Cory is writing a note]
Matthews, you're amazing, you have no idea what's going on, and yet you're still taking notes. Watcha writin'?
[Cory stuffs the note in his mouth]
Watcha eatin'?
Cory and Topanga sitting in a tree. A-B-C-D-E-F-G
[Eric and Topanga have gone on a diet together, but are keeping it a secret; Cory thinks the reason Topanga is acting differently is that she's pregnant]

[to Topanga]
Look, in a few months, everything's gonna be back to normal, okay?
All right, Eric. What's going on?
Hey, Cor. You smell like chicken.
Don't change the subject. I know Topanga confided in you. What did she tell you?
She told me that she's in trouble and it's all your fault. Your waffles and butter did this to her.
Why would Topanga confide in you instead of her own husband?
Because she knew how you'd react.
You mean like this?
[screams]
My life is over!
[back to normal voice]
Like that?
That's why she came to me, okay? People like us have similar appetites, that's how we get into situations like this.
You've been in this situation before?
Yeah, on and off since high school.
Do Mom and Dad know?
Yeah, Mom and Dad know. Dad actually thinks it's kinda funny.
[laughs]
Oh, no, Eric. There is nothing funny about this. Every day she gets bigger, my life gets a little more complicated.

Your life? Is that all you can think about? What about Topanga, huh? What is she supposed to do? Her body's out of control and she has nowhere to turn! Look, if you can't be supportive then the best possible thing for you to do is just stay away from her. Just stay away from her!

[hysterical]
I don't know what I should do!
[both run away, in opposite directions]
"When a crime breaks out, all the cute girls shout, 'Get the good-looking guy.' When there's a crime out there, he's going to comb his hair, cause he's the good-looking guy.
[speaking]
Book 'em, good-lookin'.

[sees a spider on his arm]
What do you think Mr. Birdy?
[slurred]
Birdy bit me... left side paralyzed... losing consciousness...
Last night T.K. and me talked on the phone for two hours. That beats my previous time spent on the phone with a girl by like... two hours.
I'm no rocket scientologist.
C'mon, Morgan. Let's go in the other room and watch TV.
But TV's not funny. Cory's life is funny.
Shawnzie?
Yessie?

[to Alan]
You're grounded.
Does that really work? Can she really ground you?
In certain ways, yes.
Do you think this is funny?
No, I think it's the opposite of funny. I think it's... wood.
Friendship for example, is a real gift. It's given with no expectations and no gratitude is needed, not between real friends.
Look at me, I'm breakin' the law.
[Sirens]
Well we all so that one coming.
Didn't I tell Frankie to dispose of you two?
Yeah, and he did. He killed us. Big time.
And now we're the angels of ourselves.
And now it's time for us to float away.
Float.
Have either one of you angels seen my girl.
You mean Gloria?
No, we haven't seen her.
There's no reason for us to have seen her.
We were in the locker the WHOLE time.
The whole time WHAT, boys?
Come on, Shawn. Float.
My name is Cory Matthews. I'm here with my lovely fiancée Topanga. Isn't she lovely?
They are all lovely with the lights off.
I wouldn't know sir.
You're a virgin?
I'm cursed.
All right. The name of the place where the eggs are stored.
What are... the gonads?
No, sorry, I was looking for "What are the ovaries?"
Oh, the o... yeah, I always mix those two up.
Try not to; your future will be brighter. Can you tell us anything about ovulation or how pregnancy occurs?
Well, the man's got the sperm and the woman's got the egg. Now, once a month an egg slides down the "Phillippine tube" towards the uterus.
The first sperm to reach the egg wins. It gets a medal, it's born, ya name 'em "Cory", ya push 'em out the door, and nothing makes sense for the rest of his life.
Well, congratulations; you seem to have a thorough understanding of the life cycle.
Hey, I live it!
Mommy, its me, Cory! you used to wipe my tushy!
Mr Matthews, what was I just talking aboout?

[stutters]
Uhhh...
Ok, Mr. Hunter, what was I just talking about?
President Roosevelt and the New Deal.

[clutches heart]
O dear lord he's right.
Hey Mr. Feeny, it's been my answer for two years. It had to pay off sometime!
I just want to have my picture taken, so I can send it to my grandma so she sends me a check.
After she sends the check, tell her she forgot the check. Works every time.

[referring to Shawn]
I talk, he sleeps. Its just like class.
Guess who's got pictures of Cory running naked through the sprinkler?
Eric, I was four.
You were twelve.
It was... refreshing.
No kissy?
Just talky.
I never asked to be the man in this relationship.
[on Cory's attempt to ask Topanga out]
What did you do?
I saluted her.

[about Cory]
You like him.
You little pervert.
You like him a lot.
(to Angela ina drunken haze) We don't have any Mommy's or Daddy's.
Where are you going?
With this outfit and this hair? Hello, buh-bye, I am SO at the mall.
Nothing happened.
Yeah, and it DIDN'T happen in Mom and Dad's bed. I have you. I have you by your ovaries.
I miss Linda
Yeah, I miss Linda too... and Stacey.
And Debbie.
Yeah, and Debbie.
There is no Debbie!
Huh? Then how come I miss her so much?
Because you're nuts!
You get Feeny this year?
Yeah. You?
Yeah. Which courses?
All of them.
Yeah, me too.

[Morgan is going out on a date with a boy in the 8th grade]
The 8th grade? What's wrong with the boys in the 5th grade?
I'm in the 7th grade, Dad!
[Mr. Feeny has just given Eric back his paper]
Oh... Mr. Feeny, you didn't finish your sentence. A... what?
[repeated line]
Are you kidding me?

[to Cory]
Hey, be careful. Not that I care.
When they kick you out of your apartment, you'll always have a place to stay.
I appreciate that.
Yeah, the park across the street.
An operation? Operations are bad. Do you remember our cat, Fluffy. He died during an operation.
Cory, Fluffy fell out of a tree. They were trying to sew his head back on.
[Eric is asked how he afforded a huge wedding]
So I'm picking up the tuxes, and I see that they're setting up for this big Peterman wedding next door.
Wait - "disposable diaper" Petermans?
Yeah, them Petermans.
But their wedding is, like, the social event of the year.
Yeah, well... now it's not.
What did you do?

Nothing, really. I just called the operator and asked for the number to the hotel, and while I was waiting, I noticed there was a little shmutz on the end of the phone. I couldn't tell whether it was dried vomit or gum. It *tasted* more like gum...
Get on with it!
Anyway, I told them that I was E.J. Peterman and that my daughter had to get married right away because she was pregnant. So drink up, guys, 'cause this is gonna hit the fan in, like, two seconds...
Listen, I want you to know that I am completely secure in our relationship, and if you want to spend your summer away at camp, I am totally okay with it.
That is so mature.
'cause I'm going with ya.
Cory, it's an all girls camp.
What time's swim'n?
[Topanga is interviewing Shawn about love]
Well, love is the most rare and precious thing in the whole world.
Have you ever fallen in love?
About five times a day.

[finishing a speech]
And that, Mr. Hunter, is how babies are made.
I still don't believe it.
Things aren't always easy in the real world.
I'm going to Yale. I'm going to Yale.
It's a little easier in his world
My soap opera name is Shinaynay Martin Luther King Boulevard... Boy, I've got to get some black friends.
Hey, what's up with the Weasel? She's locked herself in the bathroom singing, "On the first day of Christmas, I murdered Santa Claus.".
I married a moose.
I'm a damsel, but not the distressed kind, one who's totally calm and in complete control of her own destiny.
I can't believe it, Feeny locked us in.
He can't do that. It's against the Geneva Detention Convention.
Eric?
How did you find me?
You live here.
Okay, all right lets calmly recap.
Kenny's dead, Feeny's dead, we're trapped inside with the killer.
Somebody has to find a way out.
Fine. I'll do it. I'm the oldest.
Actually, I'm the oldest.
Yeah, but I've lived the longest.
And I guess I've been taking it pretty hard, and I'm sorry I disrupted the class and killed everyone.
Nebraska, Mr. Hunter, Nebraska!
tortias.
[about to take a picture for the yearbook]
Dumped.
Dumped.
Cheese.
[Cory thinks he is turning into a werewolf]
Come to me, Werewolf Boy.
You know.
I know many things, I know you were bitten by a wolf.
It's true.
I know you are now becoming a wolf.
That's amazing.
I know you are recently divorced.
What?
You're not Billy Joel?
No.
Well, then, you're just a wolf.
Where do you think we stand?
We're lowly, 7th grade sewer scum who name rats after ourselves to feel important.
And how do you feel about this?
Better than the guys with no rats.
If stupidity were in the Olympics, you'd win a Nobel Prize.
I had and idea for a news channel to broadcast news 24 hours a day all over the world.
You invented "CNN"?
Yes. "Chet's News Network". But I made the mistake of blabbing my idea to a southern man on an elevator.
[Chet turns to Mr. Turner]
Uh, what's your last name again?
"Turner"... No relation.

So they got Hunter kidnapped, and handcuffed to a pole, and I have to step in and save Shawn's butt, because I have a way with women, as you can probably tell by the fact that I've never been more available in my life. Tickets go on sale at the box office.
How come last night you kept me waiting for 20 minutes outside your house?
How come you parked outside my house, honked the horn, and didn't come in?
Because maybe I saw your father standing by the door and I didn't feel like saying hello.
That was my mother.
Then I definitely don't wanna meet your father.
Did you guys see Feeny out there?
Nope, not a sole, actually it was kinda creepy.
Why Creepy? Why is it creepy? Why did you say creepy? Why creepy?
Mr. Feeny, I'm sure if you recall the pain of being stabbed in the back by a girlfriend.
I didn't stab him, he stabbed me.
Oh, I'd stab myself before I'd stab you. Kenny, give me a pencil.
I don't have one!
Cory, I have got something incredible to tell you. But for security reasons, I am going to use our code.
Well, we don't have a code, Shawn.
Really? Guys like us should have a code.
Well, you know, we'll bring that up at the next meeting.
So when's our next meeting?
Shawn, we don't have meetings!
This club blows!
[after Topanga changes the rear-view mirror position while Cory drives and Cory makes her change it back]
Great! Now I can see if there are any cars coming up my crotch!
I carry this helmet to keep my head from going splat. Why do you carry that guitar case?
To protect my sandwich

[Cory and Shawn imagine themselves as old men; they are in Chubby's]
So how long have you been married?
What?

[louder]
How long you been married?
Who?

[shouting]
How long you been married?
They *want* you to take the rolls!
There's no such thing as good news until I've had my Grape Nuts.
We're gonna have a child? Wait, we've only kissed. I mean, I knew I was a good kisser, but *wow*.
I got two stupid boys. Y'all embarrass me in front of my dead friends
I accidently kissed Missy Robinson.
How do you accidently kiss someone? Did she slip on a rug, and your lips broke her fall?
I walk alone in this world... Alone I walk... Except for the grilled cheese sandwich in my pocket.
Was it the dream with the dummy again?
Yes... he was on foot... and he had a gun.
The Big Apple, City of Angels.
Tell them how you got out of study hall.
I told her I was training for the Olympic decathlon.
And she believed you?
She bought me a discus.
Don't blow me off God.
I need chocolate.
That's 16 grams of fat. And you have a purse.
Yeah, I do.
That's not really his purse. He found that purse.
Well, he found an ugly one.
Hey. I happen to like this purse.
A girl wrote seven numbers on my hand. What could this possibly mean?
It means, call her.
Shawn, how could I call her when I don't even have her- Aahh.
Shawn, I refuse to believe anything from those idiotic supermarket tabloids.
It's the New York Times, baby.
The New York Times trailer park edition.
It's exactly the same thing, except you can eat it.

[Eric is set on getting revenge on Topanga for beating him up and he is dressed as an old man inside a painting. Jack walks by and stops in shock]
I begged you. I begged you to get help

[laughs]
Oooh this is going to be so sweet. Bye, bye Topanga.
You know what, Topanga is too smart for you. Anyone is.
Stay out of this Jack. This is a one man mission. Will you help me?
No.
[leaves]
Fine. I can handle this myself.
[to the woman in the painting]
You have a very large head. I don't know why I married you.
That was then, this is... not then.

Chickens in the hallway. Chickens in the hallway. Somebody must have let 'em loose as the official senior prank. Look at 'em. Look at 'em. Oh, look at the chickens. Oh my gosh, this is crazy. I wonder which crazy senior though this up, huh? This is nuts.
Verna loved you. You had a butt she loved to pat. Unfortunately, she did not find my butt as lovable.
You see, my mom's mad at my dad because he got her a trash compactor for their anniversary.
What a yutz.
Oh, yeah. That's a long way away from tires.
Mom, did dad really promise to take you to Paris?
Of course he did... just now.
I'm telling you, that macaroni and cheese had more grease than Harley's hair.
I think that's how they made it, they just flipped him over and wrung him out. (they round the corner and see Harley who heard everything)
HARLEY.
He's just mad because he can't do this. (flips his hair)
Careful. I can't even do that.
[Harley's about to beat up Cory and Shawn when Shawn sees Gloria]
Harley, why would you waste your time beating us up when you could be spending your time with Claudia Schiffer's cuter younger sister.
Well, I wouldn't say cuter.
Turn it off.
Turning it off, sir.
[all said very fast]

That's a good one, Harley. That's a great one. I'll be laughing at that one for years and years. I'll probably be telling my grandkids about it, like sixty years from now. Unless of course, if I don't have grandkids, and then I suppose I'll have to tell some strange kids in a park. And the cops'll come and say, "Hey, you in the raincoat... "
Shut up.
Yeah, okay.
[after finding the janitor's squeaky bin alone in the halls]
Angela?
Yeah?
Are you sick of screaming?
Yes.
Then don't look in here.
[after finding the dead janitor]
Wait a second, the killer's dead. We're off the hook. Up top.
Done, Done, Done.
Enough already!
What, do we upset you?
Yes!
Upset you enough to kill?
Okay, I know I was wrong before about the janitor, but I really, really think guy's the killer.

[after Eric and a new girl named Feffy have been crushed to death by falling books]
Eric! Feffy. Eric! Aw... he was my friend, my room mate. I didn't really know her.
Welcome to John Adams High, where you are going to die. That's right, fall right this way.
I, I think that he knows we're too old for detention to scare us like it did when we were little kids right, so he's turned this school into a total chamber of horrors.
Doctor Feeny's house of terror.
What's he trying to teach us?
To pay attention or we die.
[after reading a message written with blood on the chalkboard]
It's Feeny.
There's blood on the black board, Shawn. I don't think it's because he ran out of chalk!
[Cory and Shawn have a band named The Exits]
You know, there was one point there where I thought that we really had them. They were screaming EXITS! EXITS!
Shawn, they were looking for a way out!

[his grandma gets him a baseball card]
Where did you get this?
Where did I get it? I shot a man in Reno just to watch him die... Then, I pulled this card out of his cold, dead fingers... Or I bought it at a swap meet for six bucks, you make the call!
Oh my God! He killed Kenny!
We'll always know he was this tall.
There once was a boy named Cory.
Who now has an interesting story!
He learned about kissin'...
And all he was missin'...
When he and Topanga made out!

[to Shawn]
Can you say summer school?
[Cory, Topanga, Shawn, Angela, Eric, and Jack are trapped in the high school with a murderer. He has just now murdered Mr. Feeny. They are hiding in a classroom trying to figure out what to do next]
